Class Boss

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
Core.ActiveActor
Core.ActiveActorDestructible
Core.FighterPlane
Entities.Boss
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destructible, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
MutationBoss1
public class Boss extends FighterPlane
Represents a Boss character in the game with unique abilities and behaviors such as a shield, a health bar, and complex movement patterns.

  • Property Summary

  • Field Details

    • IMAGE_NAME

      private static final String IMAGE_NAME
      The file name of the image representing the boss. Used to load the visual representation of the boss in the game.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INITIAL_X_POSITION

      private static final double INITIAL_X_POSITION
      The initial X-coordinate for the boss's position. This determines where the boss will appear horizontally on the screen when the game starts.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INITIAL_Y_POSITION

      private static final double INITIAL_Y_POSITION
      The initial Y-coordinate for the boss's position. This determines where the boss will appear vertically on the screen when the game starts.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • PROJECTILE_Y_POSITION_OFFSET

      public static final double PROJECTILE_Y_POSITION_OFFSET
      The vertical offset for the projectile's starting position relative to the Boss's position. This constant is used to align the projectile's initial Y-coordinate with the Boss's firing position.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BOSS_FIRE_RATE

      private static final double BOSS_FIRE_RATE
      The firing rate of the Boss, represented as a probability.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • BOSS_SHIELD_PROBABILITY

      private static final double BOSS_SHIELD_PROBABILITY
      The probability of the Boss activating its shield.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • IMAGE_HEIGHT

      private static final int IMAGE_HEIGHT
      The height of the boss image in pixels. Used to determine the size and scale of the boss's visual representation.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • VERTICAL_VELOCITY

      private static final int VERTICAL_VELOCITY
      The vertical velocity for the Boss's movement. This constant determines the speed of upward or downward motion.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • HEALTH

      private static final int HEALTH
      The initial health value of the boss. This represents the total number of health points the boss starts with.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MOVE_FREQUENCY_PER_CYCLE

      private static final int MOVE_FREQUENCY_PER_CYCLE
      The number of moves in each movement cycle. Defines how frequently the boss changes its movement direction.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ZERO

      private static final int ZERO
      Represents the integer value zero. Used as a constant for various calculations or comparisons.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_FRAMES_WITH_SAME_MOVE

      private static final int MAX_FRAMES_WITH_SAME_MOVE
      The maximum number of consecutive frames the boss can move in the same direction. Helps create variability in the boss's movement pattern.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • Y_POSITION_UPPER_BOUND

      private static final int Y_POSITION_UPPER_BOUND
      The upper boundary for the boss's vertical position on the screen. Prevents the boss from moving too far up off the screen.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • Y_POSITION_LOWER_BOUND

      private static final int Y_POSITION_LOWER_BOUND
      The lower boundary for the boss's vertical position on the screen. Prevents the boss from moving too far down off the screen.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_FRAMES_WITH_SHIELD

      private static final int MAX_FRAMES_WITH_SHIELD
      The maximum number of frames during which the shield can remain active. Ensures that the shield effect has a finite duration.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • movePattern

      private final List<Integer> movePattern
      The movement pattern for the Boss. This list stores a sequence of vertical velocity values (up, down, or stationary) that dictate the Boss's movement behavior.

    • isShielded

      private boolean isShielded
      Indicates whether the Boss currently has its shield activated. When true, the Boss is protected from taking damage.

    • consecutiveMovesInSameDirection

      private int consecutiveMovesInSameDirection
      Tracks the number of consecutive moves made in the same direction. Used to determine when to shuffle the movement pattern to create dynamic behavior.

    • indexOfCurrentMove

      private int indexOfCurrentMove
      Tracks the index of the current move in the boss's movement pattern. This value determines which movement direction the boss will follow next.

    • framesWithShieldActivated

      private int framesWithShieldActivated
      Tracks the number of frames during which the shield has been activated. This is used to determine when the shield should be deactivated.

    • shieldImage

      private final ShieldImage shieldImage
      The shield image associated with the Boss. This visual element is used to indicate when the Boss has an active shield.

    • healthBar

      private final javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle healthBar
      The health bar representing the boss's remaining health visually. This is a red rectangle that decreases in width as the boss takes damage.

    • maxHealth

      private final double maxHealth
      The maximum health of the Boss. This value is used to calculate the health percentage for the health bar.

    • hitboxOffsetX

      private double hitboxOffsetX
      The horizontal offset of the hitbox relative to the boss's position. This determines how far the hitbox is shifted along the X-axis.

    • hitboxOffsetY

      private double hitboxOffsetY
      The vertical offset of the hitbox relative to the boss's position. This determines how far the hitbox is shifted along the Y-axis.

  • Constructor Details

    • Boss

      public Boss()
      Default constructor. Initializes the Boss with default settings.

    • Boss

      public Boss(javafx.scene.Group root)
      Constructs a Boss with a specified root group for adding UI elements.
      Parameters:
      root - the root group where the shield image and health bar will be added.

  • Method Details

    • setHitboxOffset

      public void setHitboxOffset(double offsetX, double offsetY)
      Sets the offsets for the hitbox relative to the Boss's position.
      Parameters:
      offsetX - the horizontal offset.
      offsetY - the vertical offset.

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Description copied from class: ActiveActorDestructible
      Updates the position of this actor. Subclasses must provide an implementation for updating the actor's position.
      Specified by:
      updatePosition in class ActiveActorDestructible

    • updateHitbox

      public void updateHitbox()
      Description copied from class: ActiveActor
      Updates the position of the hitbox to match the actor's current position.
      Overrides:
      updateHitbox in class ActiveActor

    • updateActor

      public void updateActor()
      Description copied from class: FighterPlane
      Updates the actor, including its position. This method is called periodically in the game loop.
      Overrides:
      updateActor in class FighterPlane

    • fireProjectile

      public ActiveActorDestructible fireProjectile()
      Description copied from class: FighterPlane
      Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to fire projectiles.
      Specified by:
      fireProjectile in class FighterPlane
      Returns:
      an ActiveActorDestructible representing the fired projectile.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage()
      Description copied from class: FighterPlane
      Reduces the health of the FighterPlane by 1. If health reaches zero, the plane is destroyed and an explosion sound effect is played.
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in interface Destructible
      Overrides:
      takeDamage in class FighterPlane

    • updateHealthBar

      public void updateHealthBar()
      Updates the health bar width based on the current health percentage.

    • initializeMovePattern

      private void initializeMovePattern()
      Initializes the movement pattern for the Boss. The pattern alternates between moving up, moving down, and staying still. The pattern is randomized using Collections.shuffle(List).

    • updateShield

      private void updateShield()
      Updates the shield status of the boss.

      - If the shield is currently active, it increments the frame count and ensures the shield is visible. - If the shield should be activated (based on probability), it activates the shield and makes it visible. - If the shield has been active for its maximum duration, it deactivates the shield and hides it.

    • getNextMove

      private int getNextMove()
      Determines the next move in the movement pattern for the Boss. Shuffles the movement pattern after a certain number of consecutive moves in the same direction.
      Returns:
      the next move in the movement pattern.

    • shieldShouldBeActivated

      private boolean shieldShouldBeActivated()
      Determines whether the shield should be activated based on a random probability.
      Returns:
      true if the shield activation condition is met (random value is less than the shield probability), false otherwise.

    • shieldExhausted

      private boolean shieldExhausted()
      Checks if the shield has been active for the maximum allowed duration.
      Returns:
      true if the shield has been active for the maximum number of frames, false otherwise.

    • activateShield

      private void activateShield()
      Activates the shield for the Boss. This method sets the shield status to active, making the Boss temporarily immune to damage.

    • deactivateShield

      private void deactivateShield()
      Deactivates the shield for the Boss. This method resets the shield status and the frame counter for the shield's activation duration. It ensures the shield is no longer visible and the Boss is vulnerable to attacks.

    • getShieldImage

      public ShieldImage getShieldImage()
      Gets the shield image associated with the Boss.
      Returns:
      the shield image.

    • getHealthBar

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle getHealthBar()
      Gets the health bar associated with the Boss.
      Returns:
      the health bar.
